subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
Found in page 164 of {{lang|zh|《佛教難字字典》}} published in 1988.<!-- Refer Page 180 of https://ctext.org/library.pl?if=gb&res=2483140 --> The dictionary lists Japanese [[shinjitai]] forms of frequently used characters in Buddhist texts as {{w|Variant Chinese character|variant forms}} in the main text.

This character is not found in any historical texts.

subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text: {{Han simp|氣|f=米|t=㐅}} in the 1946 {{w|Tōyō kanji}} list.

subSections.title: Compounds
Etymology 1
Noun
Idioms
Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|け|yomi=o}}

From {{der|ja|ltc|sort=き|-}} {{ltc-l|氣|id=1}}.

The ''{{ll|ja|呉音|goon}}'' reading, so likely the initial borrowing. Compare {{cog|cdo|氣|tr=ké}}.

In {{w|Old Japanese}}, this kanji is used to transcribe the {{m|ja|借音|tr=shakuon}} kana of {{IPAfont|⟨ke<sub>2</sub>⟩}}.
